information: 阴道炎是一种阴道炎症，可导致产生分泌物、瘙痒和小便疼痛。原因通常是阴道菌群失调或感染。绝经后雌激素水平降低以及有些皮肤疾病也可能导致阴道炎。最常见的阴道炎类型为：细菌性阴道病。这是由于阴道中天然存在的某些细菌过度生长，破坏了天然平衡。酵母菌感染。这种感染通常由称为白色念珠菌的天然真菌导致。滴虫病。由寄生虫引起，通常通过性传播。阴道炎的体征和症状包括：阴道分泌物的颜色、气味或分泌量发生变化、阴道瘙痒或刺激、性交疼痛、排尿疼痛、阴道轻微出血或点滴出血。如果您有阴道分泌物，分泌物的特征可能表明阴道炎的类型。例如：细菌性阴道炎。您可能会有灰白色、气味难闻的分泌物。这种气味往往被描述为鱼腥味，性交后可能更明显。酵母菌感染。主要症状是瘙痒，也可能会有浓稠、呈干酪状的白色分泌物。滴虫病。一种名为滴虫病的感染可导致黄绿色、有时呈泡沫状的分泌物。
abstract: 阴道炎是阴道炎症，常导致分泌物异常、瘙痒和疼痛。主要类型包括细菌性阴道病（灰白色鱼腥味分泌物）、酵母菌感染（瘙痒和干酪状白带）和滴虫病（黄绿色泡沫状分泌物）。病因涉及阴道菌群失调、感染、雌激素水平变化等。

information: 细菌性阴道炎是育龄妇女出现阴道分泌物的常见原因之一。这种疾病是可以治疗和治愈的。不同国家和人群的细菌性阴道炎流行率不同，但最近对全球育龄妇女进行的一次系统评价和荟萃分析表明，全球育龄妇女的细菌性阴道炎的流行率在23%至29%之间。细菌性阴道炎会增加感染艾滋病毒、传播和感染其他性传播感染的风险，如不及时治疗，可能导致不良妊娠反应。细菌性阴道炎确切原因尚不清楚。虽然健康的阴道中通常存在许多“好”细菌，但细菌性阴道炎是由“好”和“有害”细菌微生物之间的不平衡引起的。更具体地说，病原体如加德纳菌属、普雷沃氏菌属、弯曲杆菌属、巨球型菌属、纤毛菌属和混合的阴道厌氧菌最终将取代有助于维持健康阴道环境的“有益的”乳酸杆菌。这种不平衡的确切原因尚不清楚，但被归因于冲洗和与新的性伴侣或几个性伴侣进行无保护性行为。一些患细菌性阴道炎的女性可能没有注意到任何症状，而其他人可能会提及：阴道异常分泌物、阴道有强烈的鱼腥味或霉味、阴道周围瘙痒或发炎、排尿时有灼热感。细菌性阴道炎是一种常见病，通常不会引起严重并发症。但是，如果不治疗，可能会导致：妊娠问题（例如自然流产和早产）、包括艾滋病毒在内的性传播感染风险增加、盆腔炎。清洗和冲洗阴道会增加患细菌性阴道炎的风险。阴道内给药，例如将草药或其他产品插入阴道，也是一个危险因素。
abstract: 细菌性阴道炎是育龄妇女常见病，全球患病率约23%-29%。由阴道内好细菌与有害细菌失衡引起，可导致灰白色鱼腥味分泌物。危险因素包括冲洗、无保护性行为等。若不治疗，可能增加HIV感染风险、性传播感染风险及妊娠并发症（如流产和早产）。

information: 外阴阴道念珠菌病（VVC）。念珠菌是单细胞真菌，在健康人皮肤、粘膜和阴道等部位均有存在。在一定条件下，念珠菌可侵犯人体组织引起炎症，其在女性生殖道的感染常常侵犯阴道，而继发引起外阴皮肤粘膜的炎症，故称之为VVC，既往曾用过念珠菌性阴道炎、真菌性阴道炎及霉菌性阴道炎等名称。全世界有数百万妇女患VVC，据统计70%的妇女一生中，至少患过一次VVC，约10-20%的健康妇女阴道中有念珠菌存在。在美国，VVC的发病率仅次于BV，居第二位。国外报道非妊娠妇女VVC的发病率为17.6%，妊娠妇女中VVC的发病率为30.2%。通常认为VVC的病原来源于口腔或肠道，皮肤上的真菌往往不是VVC的来源。80-90%的VVC是白色念珠菌引起的，少数VVC可由光滑念珠菌、近平滑念珠菌或热带念珠菌等引起。白色念珠菌为卵圆形的单壁细胞，成群分布，有芽生孢子及细胞发芽伸长而形成的假菌丝。念珠菌不耐热，加热至60℃1小时即可死亡，但对干燥、日光、紫外线及化学制剂等的抵抗力较强。约有10%的非妊娠妇女和30%的妊娠妇女阴道中有念珠菌寄生而无症状。当阴道内糖原增多，pH值降低时念珠菌容易繁殖并造成炎症，故多见于孕妇、糖尿病患者及应用雌激素者；大量长期使用抗生素后，阴道内正常菌群受到抑制而使念珠菌过度生长；长期应用免疫抑制剂或糖皮质激素，可使患者的免疫功能下降。这些因素都能促使阴道感染而发生VVC。症状包括外阴瘙痒，有较多的白色豆渣样白带是该病的主要症状。可伴有外阴烧灼感，尿急、尿痛和性交痛。症状严重时坐卧不宁，痛苦异常。体征检查见外阴肿胀，表皮可剥脱，可有抓痕。小阴唇内侧及阴道粘膜附有白色膜状物，擦除后可见阴道粘膜红肿或糜烂面及浅表溃疡。典型的白带为白色、凝块状和豆渣样，略带臭味。典型的VVC诊断不难，但易与其他外阴病变相混，故需做病原检查以确诊。直接做阴道分泌物涂片检查即可诊断。采用10%KOH悬滴法在显微镜下找芽孢和假菌丝，阳性率可达60%。用革兰染色法，其阳性率可达80%。培养法阳性率更高，且可确定敏感的抗真菌药物，但需要一段时间才能确诊，可用于难治性VVC或复发性VVC。
abstract: 外阴阴道念珠菌病（VVC）由念珠菌（主要是白色念珠菌）引起，70%女性一生至少患一次。危险因素包括妊娠、糖尿病、抗生素使用等。典型症状为剧烈外阴瘙痒和白色豆渣样白带。诊断依靠分泌物涂片镜检找芽孢和假菌丝（KOH悬滴法阳性率约60%）。

information: 阴道炎是阴道黏膜及黏膜下结缔组织的炎症，是妇科门诊最常见的疾病之一。正常阴道内存在多种微生物，形成相互制约的微生态平衡，若平衡被打破或外源病原体侵入即可导致炎症。常见类型包括细菌性阴道病（占40–50%）、外阴阴道假丝酵母菌病（20–25%）和滴虫性阴道炎（15–20%），其余为萎缩性、过敏性及原因不明的非特异性阴道炎。
abstract: 阴道炎为阴道黏膜炎症，是妇科最常见疾病，分细菌性、念珠菌性、滴虫性等类型，多因微生态失衡或外源病原体引起，占门诊炎症比例高。
source: 国家卫健委《妇科炎症诊疗指南（2021版）》

information: Bacterial vaginosis (BV) results from a shift in vaginal microbiota with a decrease in lactobacilli and an overgrowth of Gardnerella vaginalis and other anaerobes. BV is not considered a sexually transmitted infection but is associated with multiple or new sexual partners. Women typically report a thin, gray or white discharge with a fishy odor, especially after intercourse or during menses. BV has been linked to adverse pregnancy outcomes such as preterm birth and postoperative pelvic infections.
abstract: 细菌性阴道病因乳酸杆菌减少及加德纳菌等厌氧菌过度生长所致，与多性伴相关，典型表现为稀薄灰白分泌物伴腥臭，可增加早产及术后感染风险。
source: CDC - Sexually Transmitted Infections Treatment Guidelines 2021, https://www.cdc.gov/std/treatment-guidelines/bv.htm

information: Vulvovaginal candidiasis (VVC) is caused by overgrowth of Candida species, most commonly Candida albicans. Risk factors include recent antibiotic use, diabetes, high-estrogen contraceptives, and immunosuppression. Typical symptoms are vulvar itching, burning, soreness, and thick, curdy white discharge. Approximately 75% of women experience at least one episode in their lifetime, and 5–8% develop recurrent VVC (≥4 episodes per year).
abstract: 外阴阴道念珠菌病多由白念珠菌过度生长引起，常见诱因有抗生素、糖尿病、高雌激素及免疫抑制，表现为瘙痒灼痛及豆渣样白带，75%女性一生中至少发病一次。

information: Trichomoniasis is caused by the protozoan Trichomonas vaginalis and is a common sexually transmitted infection. Women may present with malodorous yellow-green discharge, vulvar irritation, dysuria, or spotting; however, 10–50% are asymptomatic. Trichomoniasis increases the risk of HIV acquisition and is associated with adverse pregnancy outcomes including premature rupture of membranes and low birth weight. Screening is recommended for women with HIV or at high risk of STIs.
abstract: 滴虫性阴道炎由阴道毛滴虫引起，为常见性传播感染，表现黄绿泡沫样分泌物及瘙痒，也可无症状，可增加 HIV 感染风险并导致不良妊娠结局。

information: Atrophic vaginitis, also called genitourinary syndrome of menopause, results from estrogen deficiency leading to thinning of vaginal epithelium, decreased lubrication, and increased pH. Symptoms include vaginal dryness, itching, burning, dyspareunia, and occasional discharge. Topical estrogen therapy is highly effective and preferred over systemic estrogen when vaginal symptoms are the primary concern.
abstract: 萎缩性阴道炎即绝经生殖泌尿综合征，因雌激素缺乏致阴道黏膜变薄、pH升高，表现为干涩瘙痒灼痛及性交痛，局部雌激素治疗高效且安全。

information: Treatment of BV: metronidazole 500 mg orally twice daily for 7 days, or metronidazole gel 0.75% intravaginally once daily for 5 days, or clindamycin cream 2% intravaginally at bedtime for 7 days. Treatment of VVC: single oral fluconazole 150 mg or topical azole (clotrimazole, miconazole) for 3–7 days. Recurrent VVC: induction with fluconazole 150 mg every 3 days for 3 doses, then weekly for 6 months. Trichomoniasis: single oral metronidazole 2 g or tinidazole 2 g; sexual partners must be treated simultaneously. No alcohol during and for 24 h after metronidazole or 72 h after tinidazole.
abstract: 细菌性阴道病首选口服或阴道甲硝唑及克林霉素；念珠菌病单剂口服氟康唑或短程局部唑类，复发者需维持6个月；滴虫性阴道炎单次大剂量甲硝唑或替硝唑并同时治疗性伴。

information: Preventive measures for infectious vaginitis include consistent condom use, limiting number of sexual partners, avoiding douching, wearing breathable cotton underwear, and prompt treatment of partners to prevent reinfection. Probiotics containing Lactobacillus crispatus may reduce recurrence of BV and VVC when used alongside antimicrobial therapy, although optimal strains and duration are still under investigation.
abstract: 预防感染性阴道炎应使用安全套、减少性伴、避免阴道冲洗、穿棉质内裤并及时治疗性伴。含卷曲乳酸杆菌的益生菌或可降低复发，但最佳方案仍在研究。

information: If left untreated, BV and trichomoniasis can facilitate upper genital tract infection (endometritis, pelvic inflammatory disease) and increase susceptibility to HIV and other STIs. Recurrent or persistent vaginitis significantly impairs quality of life and sexual function. No vaccines are currently available for BV, VVC, or trichomoniasis; research on G. vaginalis and T. vaginalis vaccine candidates is in pre-clinical stages.
abstract: 阴道炎若不治疗可上行感染致子宫内膜炎及盆腔炎，并增加 HIV 易感性。反复发作明显影响生活质量与性功能。目前尚无针对细菌性阴道病、念珠菌病及滴虫病的疫苗，候选疫苗处于临床前研究。
source: WHO - Research and Development of Vaccines against STIs, 2022

information: To diagnose vaginitis, your health care provider is likely to: Review your medical history. This includes your history of vaginal or sexually transmitted infections. Perform a pelvic exam. During the pelvic exam, your provider may use an instrument (speculum) to look inside your vagina for inflammation and discharge. Collect a sample for lab testing. Your provider might collect a sample of cervical or vaginal discharge for lab testing to confirm what kind of vaginitis you have. Perform pH testing. Your provider might test your vaginal pH by applying a pH test stick or pH paper to the wall of your vagina. An elevated pH can indicate either bacterial vaginosis or trichomoniasis. But pH testing alone is not a reliable diagnostic test. A variety of organisms and conditions can cause vaginitis, so treatment targets the specific cause: Bacterial vaginosis. For this type of vaginitis, your provider might prescribe metronidazole tablets (Flagyl) you swallow, metronidazole gel (MetroGel) that you apply to your vagina, or clindamycin cream (Cleocin) that you apply to your vagina. Other treatments include clindamycin tablets you swallow, clindamycin ovules that you insert into your vagina, or tinidazole (Tindamax) or secnidazole (Solosec) tablets you swallow. Bacterial vaginosis can recur after treatment. Yeast infections. Yeast infections usually are treated with an over-the-counter antifungal cream or suppository, such as miconazole (Monistat 1), clotrimazole (Lotrimin AF, Mycelex, Trivagizole 3), butoconazole (Gynazole-1) or tioconazole (Vagistat-1). Yeast infections might also be treated with a prescription oral antifungal medication, such as fluconazole (Diflucan). The advantages of over-the-counter treatment are convenience, cost and not having to wait to see a health care provider. The disadvantage is the possibility of treating something other than a yeast infection. Using the wrong medicine may delay an accurate diagnosis and proper treatment. Trichomoniasis. Your provider may prescribe metronidazole (Flagyl) or tinidazole (Tindamax) tablets. Genitourinary syndrome of menopause (vaginal atrophy). Estrogen — in the form of vaginal creams, tablets or rings — can treat this condition. This treatment is available by prescription from your health care provider, after other risk factors and possible complications are reviewed. Noninfectious vaginitis. To treat this type of vaginitis, you'll need to pinpoint the source of the irritation and avoid it. Possible sources include new soap, laundry detergent, sanitary napkins or tampons.
abstract: 阴道炎诊断包括病史询问、盆腔检查、分泌物样本实验室检测和阴道pH值测试。治疗需针对具体类型：细菌性阴道炎常用甲硝唑、克林霉素等抗生素；酵母菌感染可用咪康唑、克霉唑等抗真菌药；滴虫病用甲硝唑或替硝唑；非传染性阴道炎需避免刺激物；阴道萎缩可用雌激素制剂。

information: Bacterial vaginosis (BV) is a common cause of unusual vaginal discharge. BV is caused by a change in the natural balance of bacteria in your vagina. What causes this to happen is not fully known. You cannot get BV from toilet seats, bedding or swimming pools. You can get BV from having sex, especially if you have a new sexual partner or multiple partners. But BV is not classified as a sexually transmitted infection (STI). BV is not usually serious, but you should get treated because it can sometimes lead to more serious problems. Treatment for BV You can get treatment for BV from a GP or sexual health clinic. BV can usually be treated with antibiotic tablets or gels or creams. These are prescribed by a doctor and can be tablets you take by mouth or a gel or cream you put inside your vagina. It's important to complete the whole course of antibiotics, even if your symptoms go away. If BV keeps coming back, a GP may prescribe a different treatment, such as a cream or gel you use in the vagina for a longer period of time. Sometimes BV goes away without treatment. But if you have symptoms, you should get treated to avoid the risk of complications. Things you can do to help with BV It's not always clear what causes BV to develop, but there are things you can do to reduce your risk of getting it. use water and plain soap to wash your genital area, have showers instead of baths, avoid using perfumed soaps, bubble bath or shower gel in the bath, not use vaginal deodorants, douches or scented wipes.
abstract: 细菌性阴道病由阴道菌群失衡引起，确切原因不明，与性行为相关但不属性传播感染。症状包括异常分泌物，需抗生素治疗以防并发症。预防措施包括用清水和普通肥皂清洗、淋浴而非盆浴、避免使用香皂和阴道除臭剂等。

information: Vaginitis is an inflammation of the vagina. It can cause itching, burning, discharge, and pain. Common types of vaginitis include bacterial vaginosis, yeast infections, and trichomoniasis. Symptoms of vaginitis can vary depending on the cause. You may have any of these symptoms: Vaginal itching or burning, Vaginal discharge that may be white, gray, watery, or foamy, Strong fishy odor, especially after sex, Redness and swelling in the vagina and vulva, Burning when you urinate, Pain or discomfort during sex, Spotting or light bleeding. To diagnose vaginitis, your doctor will do a pelvic exam and look at your vagina and cervix. They will also take a sample of vaginal discharge to check for infections. Treatment depends on the type of vaginitis you have. Bacterial vaginosis is treated with antibiotics. Yeast infections are treated with antifungal medicines. Trichomoniasis is treated with antibiotics. Your sexual partner may also need to be treated. You can help prevent vaginitis by: Keeping your genital area clean and dry, Wiping from front to back after using the toilet, Not douching, Avoiding scented feminine hygiene products, Wearing cotton underwear, Using condoms during sex.
abstract: 阴道炎是阴道炎症，可引起瘙痒、灼痛、分泌物异常和疼痛。常见类型包括细菌性阴道病、酵母菌感染和滴虫病。诊断需盆腔检查和分泌物检测。治疗依类型而定：细菌性和滴虫性用抗生素，酵母菌用抗真菌药。预防措施包括保持清洁干燥、避免冲洗和使用有香味产品、穿棉质内衣和使用安全套。

information: Vaginitis is defined as any condition with symptoms of abnormal vaginal discharge, odor, irritation, itching, or burning. The most common causes of vaginitis are bacterial vaginosis, vulvovaginal candidiasis, and trichomoniasis. Vaginitis is a common reason for women to seek medical care. It is estimated that approximately 10 million office visits per year are due to vaginitis. Bacterial vaginosis is the most common cause of vaginitis, accounting for 40% to 50% of cases. Vulvovaginal candidiasis accounts for 20% to 25% of cases, and trichomoniasis accounts for 15% to 20% of cases. Noninfectious causes, such as atrophic vaginitis, irritants, and allergens, account for the remainder. The diagnosis of vaginitis is based on a combination of symptoms, physical examination findings, and laboratory tests. The most important laboratory tests are the vaginal pH, the whiff test, the wet mount, and the potassium hydroxide (KOH) preparation. Treatment of vaginitis should be directed at the specific cause. Bacterial vaginosis is treated with metronidazole or clindamycin. Vulvovaginal candidiasis is treated with topical or oral antifungal agents. Trichomoniasis is treated with metronidazole or tinidazole. Sexual partners of women with trichomoniasis should be treated.
abstract: 阴道炎表现为异常分泌物、异味、刺激、瘙痒或灼痛。最常见病因是细菌性阴道病（占40-50%）、外阴阴道念珠菌病（20-25%）和滴虫病（15-20%）。诊断基于症状、体检和实验室检查（pH值、胺试验、湿片和KOH制备）。治疗需针对具体病因：细菌性用甲硝唑或克林霉素，念珠菌用抗真菌药，滴虫用甲硝唑或替硝唑且需治疗性伴侣。

information: Vaginitis is an inflammatory condition of the vaginal mucosa. It is one of the most common gynecologic conditions in primary care. The three most common causes of vaginitis are bacterial vaginosis (BV), vulvovaginal candidiasis (VVC), and trichomoniasis. BV is the most prevalent cause of vaginal discharge and is characterized by a shift in the vaginal microbiota from Lactobacillus dominance to a polymicrobial mixture. VVC is caused by an overgrowth of Candida species, most commonly Candida albicans. Trichomoniasis is caused by the protozoan Trichomonas vaginalis and is a common sexually transmitted infection. Clinical features that help distinguish the different types of vaginitis include the character of the discharge, vaginal pH, and associated symptoms. BV typically presents with a thin, white, homogeneous discharge that has a fishy odor. VVC is associated with a thick, white, curdy discharge and intense pruritus. Trichomoniasis may cause a frothy, yellow-green discharge and vulvar irritation. Diagnosis is aided by office-based testing, including measurement of vaginal pH, amine (whiff) test, microscopic examination of a saline wet mount, and KOH preparation. Treatment should be tailored to the specific etiology. BV is treated with metronidazole or clindamycin. VVC is treated with topical or oral antifungal agents. Trichomoniasis is treated with metronidazole or tinidazole, and sexual partners should be treated concurrently.
abstract: 阴道炎是阴道黏膜炎症，是初级诊疗中最常见的妇科疾病之一。三种最常见病因是细菌性阴道病、外阴阴道念珠菌病和滴虫病。临床表现有助于鉴别：细菌性为稀薄灰白鱼腥味分泌物；念珠菌为稠厚豆渣样白带伴剧痒；滴虫为黄绿泡沫样分泌物。诊断依靠pH值、胺试验和显微镜检查。治疗需个体化：细菌性用甲硝唑或克林霉素，念珠菌用抗真菌药，滴虫用甲硝唑或替硝唑且需治疗性伴侣。

information: Desquamative inflammatory vaginitis (DIV) is an uncommon, chronic, inflammatory vaginitis of unknown etiology characterized by purulent discharge, dyspareunia, and vulvovaginal burning. Microscopy shows increased leukocytes and parabasal cells; lactobacilli are absent. Topical 2% clindamycin or 10% hydrocortisone is effective in most cases. Culture or PCR may identify Staphylococcus aureus or group B streptococcus as a possible trigger.
abstract: DIV 为罕见慢性炎性阴道炎，病因不明，表现为脓性分泌物、性交痛及灼热感，镜检见大量白细胞与旁基底细胞，缺乏乳酸杆菌。局部克林霉素或氢化可的松治疗多数有效。

information: Aerobic vaginitis (AV) is characterized by depletion of lactobacilli, increased vaginal pH (>4.5), and overgrowth of enteric aerobic bacteria such as Escherichia coli, Staphylococcus aureus, or group B streptococcus. Symptoms include yellowish discharge, burning, and dyspareunia. Wet mount shows >10 leukocytes per high-power field and parabasal cells. Treatment is tailored to the isolated pathogen: amoxicillin-clavulanate for E. coli, clindamycin for staphylococci or streptococci, and short topical corticosteroids for severe inflammation.
abstract: 需氧菌性阴道炎以乳酸杆菌减少、pH>4.5 及大肠杆菌等需氧菌过度生长为特点，表现为黄色分泌物、灼痛。治疗根据培养结果选用阿莫西林-克拉维酸、克林霉素等，并可短期加用局部激素。

information: Vaginal pH testing is a rapid point-of-care tool: normal reproductive-age pH is 3.8–4.5; values >4.5 suggest BV, trichomoniasis, DIV, or AV, while pH <3.8 is typical of candidiasis. Microscopy of saline wet mount and 10% KOH is recommended for all symptomatic women to differentiate causes. Culture or PCR should be reserved for recurrent or treatment-resistant cases.
abstract: 阴道 pH 快速检测有助鉴别病因：正常 3.8–4.5，>4.5 提示 BV、滴虫、DIV 或 AV，<3.8 多见于念珠菌感染。推荐生理盐水与 KOH 湿片镜检，复发或耐药病例可行培养或 PCR。

information: Recurrent vulvovaginal candidiasis (RVVC) is defined as ≥4 culture-documented episodes in 12 months. Risk factors include uncontrolled diabetes, immunosuppression, antibiotic exposure, and genetic polymorphisms in TLR2 and Dectin-1. Maintenance fluconazole 150 mg weekly for 6 months achieves clinical remission in 90% of cases; relapse rate after stopping is 30–50%. Non-albicans Candida species (C. glabrata, C. tropicalis) are more common in RVVC and may require topical boric acid 600 mg daily for 14 days.
abstract: 复发性 VVC 指12 个月内经培养证实发作≥4 次，危险因素包括糖尿病、免疫抑制、抗生素及遗传多态性。每周氟康唑 150 mg 维持 6 个月可使 90% 患者缓解，但停药后复发率 30–50%，非白念珠菌感染可用硼酸 600 mg/日 14 天。

information: Cytolytic vaginosis (CV) is an under-recognized condition caused by overgrowth of lactobacilli leading to cytolysis of vaginal epithelial cells and lactic acid accumulation. Patients present with copious white discharge, itching, and dyspareunia, often cyclically before menses. Wet mount shows numerous lactobacilli, bare nuclei, and absence of pathogens; pH is 3.5–4.0. Treatment is sodium bicarbonate sitz baths or vaginal capsules 600 mg twice weekly for 2–4 weeks to raise pH and reduce lactobacilli.
abstract: 细胞溶解性阴道炎因乳酸杆菌过度生长导致上皮细胞溶解，表现为经前白色分泌物增多、瘙痒及性交痛，pH 3.5–4.0，镜检见大量乳酸杆菌及裸核。可用碳酸氢钠坐浴或阴道胶囊提高 pH 治疗。

information: Daily probiotic capsules containing Lactobacillus crispatus CTV-05 or L. rhamnosus GR-1 and L. reuteri RC-14 taken orally for 60 days increase vaginal colonization of lactobacilli and reduce recurrence rates of BV and VVC by approximately 15–20%. Probiotics are most effective when combined with standard antimicrobial therapy and should contain at least 10^8–10^9 CFU per strain.
abstract: 口服含卷曲乳酸杆菌 CTV-05 或鼠李糖/罗伊氏乳酸杆菌组合的益生菌胶囊 60 天可提高阴道乳酸杆菌定植，使 BV 与 VVC 复发率降低约 15–20%，菌量应≥10^8–10^9 CFU。
source: PubMed - Probiotics for vaginal health meta-analysis, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/31531958/

information: Vaginal douching is associated with increased risk of BV, DIV, AV, and pelvic inflammatory disease. Douching alters the vaginal microbiome, reduces lactobacilli, and facilitates acquisition of STIs. US national surveys show 15–25% of reproductive-age women report douching; rates are highest among African American women. Counseling to discontinue douching is a recommended preventive intervention.
abstract: 阴道冲洗与 BV、DIV、AV 及盆腔炎风险增加相关，可破坏菌群并增加性传播感染。美国 15–25% 育龄女性有冲洗习惯，非裔人群比例更高，建议临床劝导停止。
